alert.note: Alert for Garfield; San Juan; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 7:01PM MDT until July 15 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SAN JUAN, NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD AND SOUTH CENTRAL WAYNE COUNTIES... At 701 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Slot canyon areas of eastern Garfield County, particularly east of the Henry Mountains and downstream areas to Lake Powell. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
